contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=June 2011}} '''Circuit noise level''': At any point in a [[transmission system]], the ratio of the [[Telecommunication circuit|circuit]] [[signal noise|noise]] at that point to an arbitrary level chosen as a reference. ''Note:'' The circuit [[noise level]] is usually expressed in dBrn0, signifying the reading of a circuit noise meter, or in [[dBa0]], signifying circuit noise meter reading adjusted to represent an interfering effect under specified conditions. {{FS1037C MS188}} [[Category:Noise]] {{telecomm-stub}}
